features: ANTI-COLIC GLASS BABY BOTTLE. Anti-Colic internal vent system is clinically proven to reduce colic. Decreases spit-up, burping and gas.
CONSISTENT FLOW RATE. Vacuum-free feeding is closest to breastfeeding and Dr. Brown’s silicone nipples provide a consistent flow so babies can feed at their own pace.
PRESERVES NUTRIENTS. The anti-colic vent system is proven to help preserve bottle milk nutrients and aids in digestion for a better night’s sleep.
BREASTFEEDING BOTTLE. The breast-like nipple shape encourages a proper latch for a more natural bottle feeding experience and eases the transition from breast to bottle and back again.

BOTTLE GROWS WITH BABY. Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ baby bottle works best with the internal vent system in place but can be removed as baby’s feeding develops – no need to introduce a different bottle.
SUSTAINABLE BABY BOTTLE. Dr. Brown’s Narrow bottle is designed to nourish through all of baby’s feeding stages and is recyclable.
DISHWASHER SAFE. Safe for use in dishwasher (top rack only), electric and microwave sterilizers or boiling water. BPA Free.
Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow Anti-Colic Options+ Narrow Glass Baby Bottle 8 oz/250 mL, with Level 1 Slow Flow Nipple, 2 Pack, 0m+
body.description: Your options have never been better with Dr. Brown’s Natural Flow® Anti-Colic Options+™ Narrow Glass Baby Bottle. The anti-colic internal vent system is clinically proven to reduce colic. Dr. Brown’s® bottles provide a more comfortable feeding experience for baby by decreasing spit-up, burping and gas. This vacuum-free feeding is closest to breastfeeding and Dr. Brown’s® silicone nipples provide a consistent flow so baby can feed at their own pace. The breast-like nipple shape encourages a proper latch for a more natural bottle feeding experience and eases the transition from breast to bottle and back again. Dr. Brown’s vent system is proven to help preserve bottle milk nutrients and aids in digestion for a better night’s sleep. The silicone nipple, together with the internal vent system, offer a reliable and trusted bottle feeding experience that makes Dr. Brown’s the #1 Pediatrician Recommended Baby Bottle in the U.S.* Dr. Brown’s® Glass bottles are heat and thermal shock-resistant, which can withstand hot and cold temperatures, along with gradual temperature changes. Made to grow with baby, our bottle is designed to nourish through all of baby’s feeding stages and is recyclable. Safe for use in dishwasher (top rack only), electric and microwave sterilizers or boiling water. BPA Free.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Glass Bottle Review
reviews.reviewText: Glass bottles are hands down better than plastic bottles.I have been using these for the last 1 year approximately . Here are some of the pros:1. Superior heat conductivity: when you are warming up a bottle at night the glass bottles is faster in getting the heat transferred to the liquid compared to your plastic.2. Easier to clean: glass bottles are easier to clean as food residue are less likely to adhere to the walls of the bottle.3. Longevity: plastic bottles deteriorates over time and the scratches from washing makes the bottle milky. The glass bottles are still shiny and there are no visible scratches on the bottle.4. Healthier: no risk of shedding microplastics when heated.5. Microwaveable: can easy heat up a bottle in the microwave.Some Cons:1. Can break easily: I have noticed the necks of the bottle can crack even from small knocks against other bottles. Will break if falls from 4/5 feet height.2. Heavier: traveling with multiple bottles in the baby bag can add to the weight.3. Doesn’t come in smaller size: it only comes in the 8oz size.Edit, Jan 24: another thing I forgot to mention was, the vent, that helps to reduce burping; It is a royal pain in the bottom when it comes to washing, it is the bane of my existence. But it is what it is, unless a design innovation happens parents will have to bear this pain.Net: You may want to buy these if you don’t like plastic. Very solid product.This review is based on my personal experience and use. I have not been paid for this review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No more micro plastics
reviews.reviewText: Great glass bottle that is light, durable, and easy to clean. Would highly suggest switching out your plastic bottles over to this glass bottle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good glass bottles
reviews.reviewText: My preemie granddaughter did very well with these bottles. Easy to clean since they are glass. She has no struggles with the nipple and doesn't swallow a lot of air. I would order them again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars We love these
reviews.reviewText: Such a great option for a quality designed bottle without having to sacrifice for a plastic option. We love that there is a glass option to minimize with micro plastic exposure. These are easy to clean and sterilize! Warning, if you are warming a bottle do it for a little less than you would a plastic bottle as this is glass and warms quicker!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love these are made out of glass
reviews.reviewText: I used Dr. Browns with my first baby and this time I wanted to use the glass bottles. I appreciate that these are the smaller size. Quality is great and will use them a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The glass of these bottles was on the thinner side and one broke by tipping over. I was looking for a great eco friendly option as I am trying to reduce my plastic useage. The other part of the bottle is the same high quality as all of their bottles. But I suggest getting or making a bottle “cozy” around the glass to protect it a little better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Well made, but very heavy!
reviews.reviewText: After buying and liking the 4oz version of this bottle, I purchased a couple of the 8oz version when my baby was about 2 mo old.The bottle itself is very well made, but It is very heavy and cumbersome. I find it very hard to feed him with the 8oz bottle and will likely be purchasing either the plastic version or another bottle type when he needs to use the larger size all the time. I would be very concerned about him holding this bottle on his own when that time comes.Note on the 4oz version. While I overall like them and have only a couple plastic ones, the glass ones are more difficult to travel with - you can’t just throw into a bag and not worry. I generally take a plastic bottle when for the diaper bag, but found it a chore to take the glass ones on a recent road trip. Also, the 4oz are a little heavy, but manageable at home.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars LOVE the glass.
reviews.reviewText: Dr. Brown has long been a trusted bottle brand. This is my first time using this thinner style bottle. I got this style because my husband prefers it.Turns out, I really like it too.I love that it's glass. They clean so much better than plastic. I like this style and the way the silicon sleeves fit it... Because I am a little clumsy, I would not use the glass bottle without the silicone sleeve. I have the shorter and taller glass bottles. And the smaller ones will age well with the baby. They are noticeably lighter than the taller ones and she will be able to hold them easier when she's older.Using these bottles, she's never had a problem with gas/tummy bubbles.2 months of using these bottles all day, every day, and no issues. I recieved one that was broken (chipped) but Amazon replaced it, so no complaints. I do always check them because they are glass... but in my opinion glass is far superior to plastic.
No complaints. They are glass and have held up well after frequent washing.
Están excelentes, perfectos para la guardería y los puedes meter al lavavajillas sin ningún problema

For babies that take to Dr. Brown bottles, these are excellent. Sterilizing glass feels safer compared to plastic. They are also sturdier. The green parts do a great job at keeping air out. I find it easy to clean as long as you give it a quick rinse after use so the milk doesn't harden up, and then wash them later when there is time.
Es buen producto pero la verdad nunca lo usé por la lactancia

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good Quality easy to clean but the plastic pipe keep smelling bad after sterilisation as well . Easy to feed . Value for money
